article.paragraph: TheCommon Desktop Environment(CDE) is adesktop environmentforUnixandOpenVMS, based on theMotif (software)Motif widget toolkit. It was part of theUNIX98UNIX98 Workstation Product Standard,cite webhttp://www.opengroup.org/openbrand/testing/prodstds.htmTesting requirements by Product StandardThe Open Group31 January 201329 September 2013and was long the "classic" Unix desktop associated with commercial Unixworkstations.

After a long history asproprietary software, CDE was released asfree softwareon 6 August 2012, under theGNU Lesser General Public License, version 2 or later.cite webhttp://www.osnews.com/story/26247/CDE_released_as_open_source CDE released as open source OSNews Thom Holwerda 2012-08-06 Since its release as free software, CDE has been ported toLinuxandBSDderivatives.
article.heading: History
Early development
article.paragraph: Hewlett-Packard,IBM,SunSoft, Inc.SunSoft, andUnix System LaboratoriesUSLannounced CDE in June 1993 as a joint development within theCommon Open Software Environment(COSE) initiative. Each development group contributed its own technology to CDE:cite press releasehttps://web.archive.org/web/20120207160207/http://bubl.ac.uk/ARCHIVE/subject/computing/misc/coseup6.htm UNIX Leaders Complete First Release of Specification for Common Open Software Environment Desktop 2014-08-19 1993-06-30 Hewlett-Packard, IBM Corporation, SunSoft, Inc., UNIX System Laboratories, X/Open Company Ltd.

list.listitem: HP contributed the primary environment for CDE, which was based on HP'sVisual User Environment(VUE). HP VUE was itself derived from theMotif Window Manager.
IBM contributed itsCommon User Accessmodel fromOS/2'sWorkplace Shell.
Sun contributed itsToolTalkapplication interaction framework and a port of itsDeskSetproductivity tools, including mail and calendar clients, from itsOpenWindowsenvironment.
USL provided desktop manager components and scalable systems technologies fromUNIX System V.

article.paragraph: After its release, HP endorsed CDE as the new standard desktop for Unix, and provided documentation and software for migrating HP VUE customizations to CDE.cite webhttp://www.hpl.hp.com/hpjournal/96apr/apr96a4.pdfMigrating HP VUE Desktop Customizations to CDEMolly JoyAugust 19962014-08-19

In March 1994 CDE became the responsibility of the "new OSF", a merger of theOpen Software FoundationandUnix International;cite press releaseAT&T Global Information Systems, Digital Equipment Corporation, Hewlett-Packard Company, IBM Corporation, SunSoft Incorporated, et al. 1994-03-23 http://groups.google.com/group/comp.unix.osf.misc/msg/4ebc895ff10823f1 Leading Vendors Unify to Accelerate Open Systems 2008-05-15 in September 1995, the merger of Motif and CDE into a single project, CDE/Motif, was announced.cite press releaseOpen Software Foundation 1995-09-07 http://groups.google.com/group/cu.motif-talk/msg/9935c0cb91e254fd OSF Announces Formal Launch of CDE/Motif Project 2008-05-15 OSF became part of the newly formedOpen Groupin 1996.cite press releasehttp://www.rdg.opengroup.org/public/news/feb96/merge.htm X/Open and OSF Join to Create The Open Group 2008-05-16 1996-02-14 [[X/Open]] Company Ltd. [[Open Software Foundation]]
In February 1997, the Open Group released their last major version of CDE, version 2.1.TOG Press Release:The Open Group Announces Common Desktop Environment 2.1

Red Hat Linuxwas the only Linux distribution to which proprietary CDE was ported. In 1997, Red Hat began offering a version of CDE licensed fromTriTeal Corporation. In 1998,Xi Graphics, a company specializing in the X Windowing System, offered a version of CDE bundled with Red Hat Linux, calledXi Graphics maXimum cde/OS. These were phased out, and Red Hat moved to theGNOMEdesktop.

Until about 2000, users of Unix desktops regarded CDE as thede factostandard, but at that time, other desktop environments such as GNOME andK Desktop Environment 2were quickly becoming mature, and became widespread onLinuxsystems.

In 2001, Sun Microsystems announced that they would phase out CDE as the standardSolaris (operating system)Solarisdesktop environment in favor of GNOME. Solaris 10, released in early 2005, includes both CDE and the GNOME-basedJava Desktop System. The Solaris 11 release in November 2011 only contains GNOME as a full desktop, though some CDE libraries, such as Motif and Tooltalk, remain for binary compatibility. TheOpenSolarisopen source project did not include CDE, and had no intent to make Solaris CDE available as open source.cite webhttp://hub.opensolaris.org/bin/view/Main/conslistConsolidations19 April 2015OpenSolaris Web sitehttp://web.archive.org/web/20120729120326/http://hub.opensolaris.org/bin/view/Main/conslist29 July 2012

article.heading: Proprietary licensing
article.paragraph: From its launch until 2012, CDE was proprietary software.

Motif, the toolkit on which CDE is built, was released by The Open Group in 2000 as "Open Motif," under a "revenue sharing" license. That license did not meet either theOpen Source Definitionopen sourceorFree software licencefree softwaredefinitions. The Open Group had wished to make Motif open source, but did not succeed doing so at that time.cite webhttp://www.opengroup.org/openmotif/faq.html Open Motif Frequently Asked Questions 2007-11-30 2004-07-13 The Open Group
article.heading: Release under the GNU LGPL
article.paragraph: In 2006, a petition was created asking The Open Group to release the source code for CDE and Motif under a free license.cite webhttp://www.marutan.net/cde/ Petition to Open Source CDE and Motif 2007-11-30 Peter Howkins On August 6, 2012, CDE was open-sourced under theGNU Lesser General Public LicenseLGPLfree software license.cite webhttp://blog.opengroup.org/2012/09/27/how-the-operating-system-got-graphical/ How the Operating System Got Graphical The Open Group Dave Lounsbury 2012-09-27 The CDE source code was then released toSourceForge.

The free software project OpenCDE had been started in 2010 to reproduce thelook and feel, organization, and feature set of CDE.cite webhttp://www.opencde.org OpenCDE 2011-02-14 kpedersen http://web.archive.org/web/20120320152927/http://devio.us/~kpedersen/ 20 March 2012 In August 2012, when CDE was released as free software, OpenCDE was officially deprecated in favor of CDE.cite webhttp://devio.us/~kpedersen/forums/viewtopic.php?idCDE Open Sourced!woomiaOpenCDE Forums6 August 2012With this, OpenCDE is officially deprecated. Feel free to make a fork of it if you wish.http://web.archive.org/web/20121125041917/http://devio.us/~kpedersen/forums/viewtopic.php?id25 November 2012

On October 23, 2012, the Motif widget toolkit was also released under theGNU Lesser General Public LicenseLGPLv2.1.cite webICS MotifZonehttp://motif.ics.com/October 2012October 2012This allowed CDE to become a completely free and open source desktop environment.
article.heading: Open-source development
article.paragraph: Since its release as free software, CDE has been ported to:cite webhttp://sourceforge.net/p/cdesktopenv/code/ci/master/tree/cde/READMECommon Desktop Environment: /cde/README21 February 2014

list.listitem: MajorLinux distributions(Slackware Linux,Debian GNU/Linux,Red Hat Enterprise Linux,Ubuntu (operating system)Ubuntu).
Solaris 11 (x86-64). Older Solaris releases are not supported because they already include CDE.

article.paragraph: Future project goals for CDE include:

list.listitem: Increased portability to more Linux, BSD, and Unix platforms.

article.paragraph: CDEbian, a Linuxlive CDbased onDebian6 with CDE 2.2.0c pre-installed, was created shortly after CDE was released as free software.http://andarazoroflove.org/code/cdebian/

In March 2014, the first stable release of CDE, version 2.2.1, was made since its release as free software.cite mailing listTrulsonJonCDE 2.2.1 releasedcdesktopenv-devel2014-03-01http://sourceforge.net/p/cdesktopenv/mailman/message/32043063/2014-03-05

Beginning with version 2.2.2, released in July 2014, CDE is able to compile under FreeBSD 10 with the defaultClangcompiler.cite mailing listTrulsonJonCDE 2.2.2 releasedcdesktopenv-devel2014-07-27http://sourceforge.net/p/cdesktopenv/mailman/message/32654428/2014-07-27
